meta.project: Asset Inventory Management System Frontend Testing

product_overview: This project focuses on comprehensive frontend automation testing for the Asset Inventory Management System (AIMS), a React and TypeScript based web app managing companies, users, assets, and audit logs. It ensures functionality, usability, and stability through unit, component, integration, E2E, visual regression, and accessibility testing.
core_goals: Ensure UI components behave correctly under all states and interactions
Validate API interaction and data flow between components and backend
Verify critical user workflows perform end-to-end without errors
Maintain high test coverage across unit, integration, and E2E levels
Catch visual and accessibility regressions early in development
Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines for continuous quality assurance
key_features: Comprehensive unit and component tests for all UI primitives (Button, Input, Select, Modal, Badge, etc.)
Business component tests for complex components like AssetCard, UserCard, CompanyCard, AuditLogCard
Page-level integration tests covering all main pages: Dashboard, Companies, Users, Assets, Audit Logs, Settings
End-to-end test workflows simulating critical paths like company setup, asset assignment, audit trail verification, and data persistence
Visual regression testing of key components and pages across device breakpoints
Accessibility testing based on WCAG 2.1 AA guidelines using axe-core integration
Test data management with fixtures, mocks, and seeding strategies
CI/CD integration with GitHub Actions to run tests automatically on push/pull requests
user_flow_summary: User lands on Dashboard, views KPIs, and navigates via sidebar to other pages
User lists and creates companies, with status filtering and pagination
User views and edits company details, manages users and assets assigned to company
User lists and creates users, filters by status and company, and deletes users
User lists and manages assets with creation, filtering, assignment, and conditional deletion
User views audit logs filtered by company, entity type, and action, with pagination and detailed views
User toggles application theme and manages settings
Modal forms open on user action for creating or editing entities, focusing input and trapping keyboard focus
Interactive cards expand/collapse to show detailed info and support data updates via API calls
validation_criteria: Unit tests cover all utility functions and UI primitives with at least 90% component coverage
Component tests properly handle all visual states, user interactions, loading, and error scenarios
Integration tests mock backend API calls and verify data flow and UI updates
E2E tests cover critical paths with real data setup and persistence validation
Visual regression tests detect UI changes across states and breakpoints
Accessibility tests report zero critical violations according to axe-core
All tests run successfully and reliably in CI/CD pipelines within defined time limits
Audit logs correctly reflect all create/update/delete actions triggered by UI operations

features.name: Dashboard Page
features.description: Main dashboard showing KPI cards (Companies, Users, Assets, Audit Logs counts), recent companies list, and recent assets list. Fetches data from API on load.

features.name: Companies Page
features.description: Lists all companies with status badges. Allows creating new companies via modal form. Shows company cards with name, description, and status.

features.name: Company Detail Page
features.description: Shows detailed view of a single company including its users with access and assets. Allows editing company details and managing user access.

features.name: Users Page
features.description: Lists all users with their email, name, status, and primary company. Allows creating new users via modal form.

features.name: Assets Page
features.description: Lists all assets with type, identifier, status, and assigned company. Allows creating new assets via modal form with company selection.

features.name: Audit Logs Page
features.description: Displays audit logs filtered by company. Requires selecting a company first. Shows entity type, action, timestamp, and changes.

features.name: Settings Page
features.description: Application settings page with theme toggle (light/dark mode) and other configuration options.

features.name: Layout Components
features.description: Main layout wrapper with sidebar navigation and top navigation bar. Sidebar shows navigation links to all pages.

features.name: UI Components Library
features.description: Reusable UI components including Button, Card, Badge, Input, Select, Modal, Table, Loading spinner, and EmptyState.

features.name: API Service Layer
features.description: Centralized API functions for all backend communication. Includes functions for companies, users, assets, company access, and audit logs CRUD operations.

features.name: Auth Context
features.description: React context for authentication state management (placeholder for future auth implementation).

features.name: Theme Context
features.description: React context for theme management (light/dark mode toggle).

features.name: Type Definitions
features.description: TypeScript interfaces for all data models: Company, User, Asset, AuditLog, CompanyAccess, and API request/response types.

features.name: App Router
features.description: Main application routing configuration using React Router. Defines routes for Dashboard, Companies, Users, Assets, Audit Logs, and Settings.

test_guidance.navigation: Use sidebar links to navigate between pages. Sidebar is always visible on the left.
test_guidance.forms: Modal forms are used for creating new entities. Click 'Add' or 'Create' buttons to open modals.
test_guidance.api_dependency: Frontend connects to backend API. Ensure backend is running for full functionality tests.
